business.headline: We want to double our stores in India in next 2-3 years: Hugo Boss CEOIn an exclusive conversation with India Today, Hugo Boss CEO Daniel Grieder discusses the company's strategic focus on the Indian market.

Arvind Panagariya on why India's trade deals with US, EU could be bigger moment than 1991In an exclusive interview with India Today, Dr. Arvind Panagariya, Chairman of the 16th Finance Commission and former Vice-Chairman of NITI Aayog, shares his thoughts on the landmark India-US trade deal and more.

From policies to AI: How businesses and governments can deliver at scaleMohit Joshi and Kaan Terzioglu discussed the importance of long-term thinking, ethical practices, and digital solutions in building credibility with customers, governments, and societies.

Elon Musk becomes world's first person with $800 billion after SpaceX-xAI dealMusk is now $578 billion richer than Google co-founder Larry Page, the world's second-wealthiest person, who is estimated to be worth $281 billion.

Gold jumps nearly 4%, silver up 6%: Is the rally set to continue?At the time of writing, gold was priced at Rs 1,58,858, up 3.28% or Rs 5,049. Silver showed an even stronger recovery, trading at Rs 2,83,395, higher by 5.74% or Rs 15,380.

Sensex, Nifty end higher amid volatile trade; Infosys falls over 7%The S&P BSE Sensex closed 78.56 points higher at 83,817.69, while the NSE Nifty50 added 48.45 points to settle at 25,776. Most broader market indices also finished positive, even as intraday volatility spiked.

Infosys, TCS shares tumble amid global tech sell-off: Is the AI fear justified?Was today's slide in IT stocks a glimpse of the future or just market overreaction? For investors, the only question now is whether the AI threat is real or simply rattling nerves.

Why Hugo Boss sees India as a key growth market amid global slowdownHugo Boss currently has around 15 stores in India and plans to double that number over the next two to three years. According to its CEO, the brand is being well received by both men and women in the country.

Extended ITR deadline explained: Who can file till August 31 and who can'tFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman clarified this during her Budget speech, saying that only specific taxpayers would get extra time, while most individuals would continue to follow the existing deadline.

Why banks are using IVR checks for high-value UPI paymentsOne of the most common safety steps used today is IVR verification, where banks confirm a transaction through an automated phone call before money is transferred.

Global tech sell-off hits Indian IT stocks: Could this trigger more layoffs?AI has started influencing how the IT industry works and hires. Understanding today's developments helps IT professionals see where the real opportunities are and what adjustments may be needed over time.

Deepinder Goyal calls ex-employees back to Zomato, says I want you backAccording to Goyal, the company already has more than 400 employees who are currently in their second or third stint with the group.

Why Anthropic's new AI tools rattled Wall Street's tech giants, hit Indian IT stocksThe slide in IT stocks is not just about prices. It reflects the new uncertainty AI brings to global tech. Knowing what sparked it helps decode what lies ahead for the sector.

How buying gold on an app is pushing real gold prices higherIt is not just safe haven demand or industrial demand alone driving gold and silver prices higher. A quiet shift in how people buy gold and silver is changing real-world supply and prices.
Infosys, TCS sink up to 8%: Why are IT stocks falling today?A fresh AI development in the US set off a chain reaction that landed right on Dalal Street. This story helps you make sense of the chaos.
Sensex, Nifty fall as IT stocks sink, Infosys tumbles over 6%At 9:21 am, the Sensex traded at 83,645.60, down 93.53 points, while the Nifty hovered at 25,718.50, slipping 9.05 points.

Trump's top economic adviser Stephen Miran resigns from White House roleStephen Miran has resigned as chair of the White House's Council of Economic Advisers to focus on his Federal Reserve role. The move follows Trump's nomination of Kevin Warsh to fill Miran's Fed Board seat, signalling shifts in economic leadership.

India set to keep some agriculture protections under US deal: Trump's trade chiefThe Trump administration is finalising the India trade deal, which will cut India's tariffs on US industrial goods from 13.5% to zero while allowing New Delhi to retain some protections on agricultural imports, US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer said.

Which products Americans are searching amid India-US trade dealIndian textiles, diamonds and jewellery dominate exports globally, but American interest appears to rest with a far smaller commodity, a tiny crustacean.

Sensex ends 2,000 points higher: Here's why the stock market jumped todayThe S&P BSE Sensex jumped 2,072.67 points to close at 83,739.13, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 639.15 points to settle at 25,727.55. The Nifty recorded its best single-day gain since May 2025, showing a strong return of buying interest after recent weakness.

entertainment.headline: Arjun Kapoor's viral post exposes us: We knew, and we mocked anyway Arjun Kapoor's post about his mother opens up a larger conversation on grief, endurance, and what we, on the internet, choose to overlook.

Are Talwiinder and Disha Patani dating? Singer finally breaks silence Talwiinder has finally addressed the dating rumours with Disha Patani. Here's what he revealed about his feelings and the mysterious bond sparking social media frenzy.

Did you know Zayn Malik's new album Konnakol has Indian musical influence? Singer Zayn Malik is back with a fifth album that promises a bold new sound. Fans are already wondering what the mysterious title Konnakol really means. Read more to find out.

Ghooskhor Pandat title row: Mumbai advocate sends legal notice to Netflix, makers According to the notice, the title Ghooskhor Pandat is "per se offensive" and objectionable because it combines a term commonly associated with bribery and corruption with the word Pandit, which Dubey described as a historically respected cultural, religious, and intellectual identity.

Alia Bhatt, Sharvari's Alpha to have a theatrical release: Source Contrary to speculation, Alpha, the first female-led spy thriller in its franchise starring Alia Bhatt, will have a theatrical release. The film's release was postponed from Christmas 2025 to allow more time for VFX work.

Ranbir Kapoor's Animal Park to go on floors in mid-2027: Sandeep Reddy Vanga Director Sandeep Reddy Vanga has announced that filming for the sequel to Animal will begin in mid-2027, with Ranbir Kapoor returning to play dual roles. The announcement was made during a media interaction ahead of the film's release in Japan.

Sonu Sood flags online gaming risks after Ghaziabad triple suicide case Actor Sonu Sood has urged for restrictions on social media and online gaming for children under 16, following the suicide of three sisters in Ghaziabad reportedly linked to online gaming addiction.

Stay the hell out of the press: Nelson Peltz's advice to Brooklyn and Nicola Nelson Peltz has publicly addressed the ongoing family tension between his daughter Nicola Peltz Beckham, her husband Brooklyn Peltz Beckham, and the Beckham family after recent revelations about their relationship.

Shraddha Kapoor was crying: Tejaswini Kolhapure on Siddhanth's arrest in drugs case Tejaswini Kolhapure recalled the emotional toll Siddhanth Kapoor's 2022 drug case arrest took on their family. She revealed that Shraddha Kapoor was left in tears when a political party staged a protest and shouted slogans outside Shakti Kapoor's residence, causing them significant distress.

Siddhant Chaturvedi on Bhojpuri roots: For five-six years, even my Hindi was broken Siddhant Chaturvedi opened up about his upbringing in Uttar Pradesh and Bhojpuri roots during the trailer launch of Do Deewane Seher Mein. He recalled the initial language challenges he faced in Mumbai.

Yami Gautam to have an action-packed cameo in Aditya Dhar's Dhurandhar 2: Report Actor Yami Gautam will reportedly take on a special cameo in Dhurandhar: The Special Revenge. Directed by Aditya Dhar and headlined by Ranveer Singh, the film is slated to release on March 19.

The Kerala Story 2 song Saathi Re: Soulful track talks of love turned into betrayal The first track from The Kerala Story 2- Goes Beyond, titled Saathi Re, has been released. The song lays out the emotional arcs of the film's female protagonists and introduces pivotal male characters.

Kalpana Iyer on long break: Bollywood has changed; didn't get work all these years After her 1981 song Ramba Ho trended following Dhurandhar, veteran actor Kalpana Iyer's dance video has now gone viral. In an exclusive interaction with India Today, she discusses her life in Dubai, her exit from the industry, and her readiness to return to acting.

Ajay Devgn shares Shatak teaser, congratulates RSS on completing 100 years Actor Ajay Devgn shared the teaser of Shatak, a film that marks 100 years of Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS). The film highlights RSS's role in nation-building and has set off social media reactions.

Varanasi director SS Rajamouli recalls James Cameron's advice on filmmaking Filmmaker SS Rajamouli opened up about the advice he received from Avatar director James Cameron. Slated for a 2027 release, the filmmaker's upcoming film Varanasi stars Mahesh Babu and Priyanka Chopra Jonas in lead roles.

Malaika Arora reacts to ex Arjun Kapoor's 'life's been cruel to me lately' post Malaika Arora was among several Bollywood celebrities who reacted to Arjun Kapoor's heartfelt post on his mother's birth anniversary. The actor had reflected on recent personal challenges in a message shared on social media.

Ram Charan's Peddi pushed to April as Pawan Kalyan's film takes over release slot Ram Charan's film Peddi, also starring Janhvi Kapoor, has been postponed for release in April this year. The film's original release date in March has now been taken over by Pawan Kalyan's upcoming film.

Assi trailer: Taapsee Pannu is a lawyer again in an Anubhav Sinha film after Mulk The trailer for Anubhav Sinha's Assi, featuring Taapsee Pannu as a relentless lawyer, dropped on February 4. The hard-hitting investigative drama also features Mohammed Zeeshan Ayyub, Manoj Pahwa, Kumud Mishra, Kani Kusruti and Revathy in key roles.

Meryl Streep, Tom Cruise, George Clooney in K3G? Karan Johar reacts to AI casting A viral AI video reimagining Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham with Hollywood stars has attracted the attention of filmmaker Karan Johar, as he shares his reaction and hints at the possibility of a sequel to the popular Bollywood film.

general news.headline: India free to buy from any country: Russia on Venezuelan oil purchase talksIndia imports nearly 88% of its crude, with Russian oil emerging as a key source after 2022. Moscow said India is free to diversify, but replacing Russian volumes is not commercially simple.

Won't be bullied, will wait out Trump term for trade deal, Doval told RubioThe Modi government had conveyed to the US in early September 2025 that it was willing to wait out the Trump presidential term if needed on the India-US trade deal. This tough line was conveyed to US Secretary of State Marco Rubio by India NSA Ajit Doval, according to a Bloomberg report. The report on the meeting and the mellowing down of Trump and his aides after that gives a new perspective to the debate over the India-US trade deal.

Epstein's ex invited him home when daughter was 15: She'll have 5 friends overJeffrey Epstein had already served jail time in Florida in a trafficking case and was registered as a sex offender when he exchanged emails with Eva Andersson-Dubin, his on and off girlfriend throughout the 1980s.

Yunus's rush to ink secretive deal with US has Bangladesh exporters worriedThe interim setup of Muhammad Yunus is set to sign a tariff deal with the US. However, the non-disclosure agreement that keeps details shrouded in mystery has got Bangladeshi business leaders concerned. Then there is a bigger question. Is it legal for the unelected Yunus regime to ink a deal even as an elected government could come to office in weeks time?

Arjun Kapoor's viral post exposes us: We knew, and we mocked anywayArjun Kapoor's post about his mother opens up a larger conversation on grief, endurance, and what we, on the internet, choose to overlook.

Black shawl, SIR battle: Inside Mamata Banerjee's high-drama day in Supreme CourtAs the courtroom battle unfolded, Mamata Banerjee took the unprecedented step of arguing in person before the Chief Justice of India, carrying the SIR fight beyond the streets and the political arena into the country's highest court.

Trampoline Trump puts Modi govt in a bind: Can neither boast, nor debunkPresident Donald Trump has put the Modi government in a spot by jumping to announce the finalisation of the India-US trade deal. He has exposed the government to attacks for at least the time it makes the deal details public.
T20 World Cup: Pakistan PM confirms no change in India boycott stancePakistan Prime Minister Shahbaz Sharif confirmed that Pakistan will not play against India in the T20 World Cup 2026 group stage.

Video: Lift turns into fireball as hydrogen balloons ignite in Mumbai high-riseA routine lift ride in Mumbai's Goregaon West turned dangerous after a hydrogen gas–filled balloon burst inside an elevator, triggering a brief fire that left two people with minor injuries.

He should be very worried: Trump warns Iran's Khamenei ahead of Oman talksDonald Trump warned Iran's supreme leader should be very worried as US-Iran nuclear talks are set to resume on Friday in Oman amid rising tensions, military pressure and sharp disagreements over missiles and sanctions.

Over 800 people went missing in Delhi in first 27 days of 2026; 137 children still untracedBetween 2015 and 2025, thousands of missing cases were registered in Delhi, many of which are yet to be resolved. Over the last 11 years alone, 5,559 children were reported missing from the capital, and 695 of them have still not been traced.

Women MPs gheraoed PM's chair: What happened inside Lok Sabha minutes before speechSources said that after the House was adjourned, Congress and other opposition women MPs again moved towards the treasury benches, advancing up to two rows behind the Prime Minister's chair and heading in the direction of BJP MP Nishikant Dubey.

Watch: Drone visuals of massive 22-km traffic jam on Mumbai-Pune ExpresswayHere's the drone visuals of the massive traffic jam on the Mumbai-Pune Expressway, which has hit vehicular movement for over 24 hours after a gas tanker overturned in the hilly Khandala Ghat section.

How golgappas, Bangladesh shooter shot down BCB's security alarmWhat Bangladesh's Cricket Board framed as a security concern in India has been exposed through reality. A Bangladeshi shooter is competing in New Delhi, American cricketers are enjoying golgappas on Mumbai's streets, and teams are moving freely. These have exposed how Bangladeshi alarm was about selective politics.

Regret meeting Epstein: Bill Gates opens up about allegations against himMicrosoft co-founder Bill Gates has denied allegations arising from recently released Epstein Files emails, responding to claims of sexually transmitted disease and inappropriate conduct stated in unsent emails by Jeffrey Epstein.

Shashi Tharoor's son Ishaan laid off as Washington Post fires one-third of staffWashington Post has laid off nearly one-third of its staff, closing key sections including sports and foreign bureaus. The cuts raise concerns about the future of global journalism at one of America's leading newspapers.

Layoffs chatter gets stronger as Claude AI threatens SaaS's core businessThis Wednesday is turning out to be a day of an earthquake in the Indian IT industry. The reason is Claude AI and how it is positioning itself as a SaaS killer. The result is that stocks of IT companies are down and there is already chatter around upcoming layoffs that may hit companies like Infosys and TCS.

Man who tried to assassinate Trump at Florida golf course gets life sentenceRyan Routh, 59, was convicted last September on five criminal counts, including attempted assassination, after a jury found he had waited for hours in bushes near a golf course where Trump was playing.

Son of Norway crown princess cries during rape trial, blames 'need for recognition'The 29-year-old, who is accused of raping four women and faces more than 30 other criminal charges, told judges he had struggled for years with public attention due to "an extreme need for recognition", which he said from an early age pushed him to crave sex, alcohol and drugs.

A book for a book: Nishikant Dubey's excerpts on Gandhis spark Priyanka's counterThe battle lines are now drawn. After Rahul Gandhi claimed that Prime Minister Narendra Modi was compromised while attempting to cite from an unpublished book, BJP MP Nishikant Dubey on Wednesday hit back at the Congress, displaying a series of books which he said detailed decades of deception, betrayal, and corruption of the Nehru-Gandhi family.

The modern Buddhist Circuit: Where UP's fertile plains meet Japan's templesBeyond trade deals and defence pacts, a spiritual corridor is emerging between Uttar Pradesh and Japan. And the Buddhist Circuit stands in the middle of it.

UK PM Starmer under siege after admitting knowledge of Mandelson-Epstein tiesMPs voted to allow the publication of papers relating to Lord Mandelson's appointment as UK ambassador to the US after pressure from angry Labour backbenchers forced the government to retreat.

15 minutes to PM's speech, Lok Sabha slid into chaos: A firsthand accountIndia Today's Aishwarya Paliwal provides a step-by-step eyewitness account of the Lok Sabha drama as women opposition MPs marched toward BJP leaders, just before Prime Minister Narendra Modi was scheduled to address the Motion of Thanks on the President's Address, which was postponed at the last moment.

Sorry, papa: 3 girls die by suicide; K-culture obsession angle emergesThree sisters died after they allegedly jumped off the ninth floor of their residential building in Ghaziabad. Police sources ruled out the victims being addicted to a task-based Korean online gaming app and that they were influenced by Korean culture.

sports.headline: Time to stand up to BCCI, 400 million now on one side: Ex-Pak cricket chief T20 World Cup 2026: Speaking to India Today, former Pakistan Cricket Board chief Najam Sethi said Pakistan is now standing up to BCCI by announcing the boycott of their game against India. Sethi said the ICC is run by people in the BCCI and Pakistan are willing to let go off short-term financial gains to end the bullying of the global cricket body.

Sanju Samson's fate sealed? Job's not finished with T20 World Cup 2026 in sight With India's T20 plans taking shape, Sanju Samson faces a reduced role ahead of the 2026 World Cup. Staying ready, and being used wisely, may decide his future.

ISL's new broadcast deal leaves it even below local leagues The ISL has its broadcast deal, but the numbers tell a harsher story. Now, valued below regional leagues and nowhere near cricket, Indian football's top tier has fallen from grace.
T20 World Cup: Pakistan PM confirms no change in India boycott stance Pakistan Prime Minister Shahbaz Sharif confirmed that Pakistan will not play against India in the T20 World Cup 2026 group stage.

Could Goa break unsettle RCB? Smriti Mandhana opens up ahead of WPL final WPL 2026: Smriti Mandhana said that Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) are fresh for the final against Delhi Capitals (DC) after they spent their one-week break enjoying in Goa.

IND vs SA, warm-up: Ishan edges Samson, Tilak back as India ready to defend crown IND vs SA, T20 World Cup Warm-ups: India's only warm-up turned into a statement as Ishan Kishan sealed the opener role, Tilak Varma returned in style, and the bowlers controlled the chase to down South Africa by 30 runs.

India among six bidders to host football's Asian Cup 2031 India is among six nations bidding to host the AFC Asian Cup 2031, the Asian Football Confederation confirmed, as the country renews its push to stage the continent's top football tournament with full government backing.

PCB face heavy financial losses if they refuse to play India at T20 World Cup: Report The Pakistan Cricket Board risks significant financial losses if penalised by the ICC for not playing India in the T20 World Cup. This could lead to serious financial challenges amid ongoing stadium upgrades and revenue dependencies.

IND-PAK match can happen if Bangladesh are reinstated at T20 World Cup: Ex-PCB chief Former chief of the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB), Najam Sethi believes that there is still a chance that the India-Pakistan game can take place if Bangladesh are reinstated with their games being held in Sri Lanka.

Aaron George's 115 helps India chase a record 311 vs Afghanistan to reach final ICC U19 World Cup: India scripted a remarkable chase as opener Aaron George's heroic century powered them past a record 311 against Afghanistan in the second semi-final, setting up a title clash with England.

Ishan Kishan's blitz as opener vs South Africa puts Samson under serious pressure IND vs SA, T20 World Cup: Ishan Kishan went berserk in the warm-up match against South Africa at the Dr DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai, scoring 53 off 20 balls with seven sixes before retiring out.

Fitness is getting better and I will be back soon: Rishabh PantIndia's wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant on Tuesday said he is recovering well from his injury and is hopeful of returning to competitive cricket at the earliest.

From JJ Smuts to Wayne Madsen: Italy's T20 World Cup stars you can't missT20 World Cup 2026: Italy are set to make their maiden appearance on the global stage. Led by Wayne Madsen, the Azzurri face a stern challenge in a tough group that also features England and the West Indies.

Mirabai Chanu shatters three national records at Weightlifting ChampionshipsIndian weightlifting star Mirabai Chanu continued her record-breaking run, rewriting the national marks with a commanding display at the National Weightlifting Championships on Wednesday.

U19 World Cup: Vaibhav steps up under pressure with 33-ball 68 in semi-finalIND-U19 vs AFG-U19: Vaibhav Sooryavanshi delivered a fearless counterattack under pressure, smashing 68 off just 33 balls to give India a flying start in their chase against Afghanistan in the Under-19 World Cup 2026 semi-final at the Harare Sports Club on Wednesday.

IND vs SA warmups Highlights: India beat South Africa by 30 runs in Navi MumbaiIND vs SA T20 World Cup Warm-Up Match: India beat South Africa by 30 runs at the Dr DY Patil Sports Academy in Navi Mumbai to win the warm-up match on Wednesday.

Rohit, Kohli for ODI World Cup? Dhoni tells Agarkar to focus on fitness, not ageFormer India captain MS Dhoni has given his verdict that Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli should be considered for the ODI World Cup in 2027. Dhoni's viewers have found a lot of takers among fans.

Sachin Tendulkar rallies Mumbai with timely pep talk before Ranji Trophy quarterfinalSachin Tendulkar shared insights on pressure and preparation with the Mumbai squad ahead of their Ranji Trophy quarterfinal against Karnataka, offering timely motivation before the knockout clash.

Inspired by Hardik Pandya, Bas de Leede aims for 'big man moments' in World CupNetherlands beat South Africa in the ODI World Cup hosted in India back in 2023. As they return for yet another world tournament, all-rounder Bas de Leede hopes to inspire them to consistency in big events.

Ishan Kishan jumps 32 spots, Saim Ayub becomes No. 1 T20I all-rounderIndia's Ishan Kishan has climbed 32 places to No.32 in the latest ICC Men's T20I batter rankings following his performances in the home series against New Zealand. Meanwhile, Pakistan's Saim Ayub has moved to the top of the T20I all-rounder rankings.

MS Dhoni rules out commentary stint, reveals why he avoids using phoneFormer India captain MS Dhoni has all but ruled out a move to the commentary box, describing the popular post-retirement role as a demanding craft that requires a delicate balance and a sharp command of statistics, something he admits does not come naturally to him.

Pep Guardiola vows to speak up for victims of global conflicts ahead of World CupPep Guardiola made an impassioned plea to "protect human life" in an emotional news conference, during which the Manchester City head coach referenced the recent deaths of Renee Good and Alex Pretti in Minneapolis.

IND v SA, T20 World Cup warm-up: Now or never for Sanju Samson?IND vs SA, T20 World Cup warm-up match: Even champions have doubts to settle. India's warm-up against South Africa doubles as a selection trial, with Sanju Samson's opening spot under threat from the in-form Ishan Kishan this week.

IND U19 vs AFG U19 Highlights: India hammer Afghanistan to set up final vs EnglandIndia (IND) vs Afghanistan (AFG) Highlights, U19 World Cup 2026 semifinal: India beat Afghanistan by seven wickets on Wednesday at the Harare Sports Club to qualify for the final, where they will face England.

Boycott India, forget Super 8s: Why rain is Pakistan's biggest foe in ColomboT20 World Cup: Pakistan have decided to boycott their group stage match against India in Colombo. But can they afford to waste a game when two of their other matches are threatened by rain?

T20 World Cup: Pakistan can brag about series win, but don't count Australia outPakistan have every right to enjoy a 3-0 sweep of Australia so close to a T20 World Cup, but the context tempers the celebration. Australia travelled with a depleted squad and used the series as preparation, and history shows they have often stumbled before global tournaments, only to find their best form when it matters most.

Can India defend T20 World Cup? MS Dhoni gives his verdict on Suryakumar's teamMS Dhoni believes India are primed for a historic T20 World Cup title defence at home. The former captain, however, warns that dew and toss conditions could still decide crunch matches.

Pakistan being unfair to own players with India boycott: Kapil DevKapil Dev has warned Pakistan that boycotting India at the T20 World Cup will only hurt their own players. He says the ICC consequences will linger long after the headlines fade.

Carabao Cup: Arsenal boost treble hopes as Chelsea win books final spotArsenal edge past Chelsea to reach the Carabao Cup final and keep a multi-trophy season alive. With Wembley booked, Arteta's side quietly strengthen their treble hopes and keep the quadruple dream ticking.

U-19 World Cup: Invincible India take on resilient Afghanistan for a spot in the finalHaving stormed into the semi-finals without dropping a single game in the Under-19 World Cup 2026 so far, India will face the underdogs Afghanistan in the all-important clash. The Ayush Mhatre-led side will look to advance to the final without much trouble, to take on England in the summit clash.

England complete T20 series sweep vs Sri Lanka to cap ideal World Cup build-upEngland completed a 3-0 T20I series sweep over Sri Lanka with a 12-run victory in the third and final match at Pallekele, rounding off their preparations for the ICC Men's T20 World Cup on a high.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
